name: Taiwan
description: Taiwan, officially the Republic of China, is an island nation located in East Asia, off the coast of mainland China. Known for its dramatic landscapes, including towering mountains, lush forests, and stunning coastlines, Taiwan boasts a rich cultural heritage and a vibrant economy. It’s a biodiversity hotspot, home to a diverse range of flora and fauna, and offers a wide array of outdoor activities and cultural experiences.

quickFacts.label: Capital
quickFacts.description: The bustling capital city of Taiwan, a hub of commerce, culture, and technology.
quickFacts.detail: Taipei is renowned for its vibrant night markets, impressive museums, and modern architecture.

quickFacts.label: Population
quickFacts.description: Taiwan has a densely populated population, contributing to its dynamic urban landscape.
quickFacts.detail: The majority of the population resides in urban areas, particularly around Taipei and Taichung.

quickFacts.label: Area
quickFacts.description: Taiwan's relatively small size belies its incredible diversity of landscapes.
quickFacts.detail: The island is dominated by mountainous terrain, with only a small percentage of the land being arable.

quickFacts.label: Official Language
quickFacts.description: Mandarin Chinese is the official language and is widely spoken throughout the island.
quickFacts.detail: Taiwanese Hokkien (Min Nan) is also a prevalent dialect, alongside Hakka and Tsou.

quickFacts.label: Currency
quickFacts.description: The New Taiwan Dollar is the official currency of Taiwan.
quickFacts.detail: It's a stable currency and widely accepted throughout the country.

climateData.title: Taiwan's Diverse Climate
climateData.description: Taiwan experiences a subtropical climate with significant regional variations due to its mountainous terrain. The north is cooler and wetter, while the south is warmer and drier.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Spring (March - May)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Spring brings a gradual warming, with blooming flowers and lush greenery. It's a popular time for outdoor activities.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Summer (June - August)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Summer is hot and humid, with frequent rainfall. Typhoons are common during this season.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Autumn (September - November)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Autumn offers pleasant temperatures and clear skies. It's considered the best time to visit Taiwan.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Winter (December - February)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Winter is mild and wet, with occasional cold snaps. Snowfall is rare, mainly in the higher mountains.

naturalWonders.name: Taroko Gorge
naturalWonders.description: Taroko Gorge is a stunning marble canyon carved by the Liwu River. Its towering cliffs, lush forests, and turquoise rivers create a breathtaking spectacle.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The gorge is renowned for its dramatic scenery and is a popular destination for hiking and exploring. The marble formations are particularly impressive, showcasing a variety of colors and textures.

naturalWonders.name: Sun Moon Lake
naturalWonders.description: Sun Moon Lake is Taiwan's largest lake, nestled amidst rolling hills and forested mountains. It's a serene and picturesque destination.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The lake is surrounded by temples, aboriginal villages, and scenic trails. Boat tours and cycling are popular ways to explore the area.
viewingTips: Rent a bike to explore the lake

naturalWonders.name: Yushan National Park
naturalWonders.description: Yushan National Park encompasses Taiwan’s highest peak, Yushan (Jade Mountain), and a vast expanse of pristine forests and alpine meadows.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The park offers incredible hiking opportunities, diverse wildlife viewing, and stunning panoramic views. It’s a haven for nature lovers and adventure seekers.

biodiversityCategory.name: Endemic Flora and Fauna
biodiversityCategory.description: Taiwan is renowned for its unique biodiversity, with a significant number of plant and animal species found nowhere else on Earth.

statistics.details: Many of these plants are endemic to Taiwan's diverse ecosystems.
Including numerous endemic bird species, reptiles, and amphibians.

notableSpecies.name: Formosan Black Bear
notableSpecies.significance: Taiwan's largest mammal, playing a crucial role in seed dispersal.

notableSpecies.name: Red Eared Dragon
notableSpecies.significance: A unique and beautiful reptile found only in Taiwan's streams and rivers.

notableSpecies.name: Taiwan Blue Magpie
notableSpecies.significance: A striking bird species with vibrant blue plumage.

ecosystemData.title: Taiwan's Diverse Ecosystems
ecosystemData.overview: Taiwan’s ecosystems range from subtropical rainforests to alpine meadows and coral reefs, each supporting a unique array of plant and animal life.

biodiversityCategories.name: Tropical Rainforest
biodiversityCategories.description: Taiwan’s tropical rainforests are home to a vast array of plant and animal species, including many endemic species.

statistics.details: Including ancient trees and rare orchids.

biodiversityCategories.name: Coastal Ecosystems
biodiversityCategories.description: Taiwan’s coastline is characterized by diverse habitats, including coral reefs, mangrove forests, and rocky shores.

statistics.details: Supporting a rich diversity of marine life.

activities.title: Outdoor Activities in Taiwan
activities.description: Taiwan offers a wide range of outdoor activities for all skill levels, from leisurely hikes to challenging climbs.

activityCategories.name: Hiking
activityCategories.description: Explore Taiwan’s stunning mountain trails and discover breathtaking views.

activities.name: Taroko Gorge Trail
activities.description: Hike through the dramatic Taroko Gorge, exploring its stunning marble formations and scenic trails.

activities.name: Mount Jade Trail
activities.description: A challenging climb to the summit of Taiwan’s highest peak, offering panoramic views.
activities.requirements: Hiking boots, warm clothing, altitude sickness medication

activityCategories.name: Water Sports
activityCategories.description: Enjoy a variety of water activities in Taiwan’s beautiful coastal waters.

activities.name: Sun Moon Lake Boat Tour
activities.description: Take a relaxing boat tour around Sun Moon Lake, enjoying the stunning scenery.

activities.name: Scuba Diving at Kenting
activities.description: Explore the vibrant coral reefs and marine life of Kenting National Park.

equipment.hiking: Hiking boots, trekking poles, map, compass

safety: Inform someone of your hiking plans
